project.description:
#Trigger command curl -X POST "http://voltha:11aad495d8f017648827a9c41468cd6c6e@172.17.10.60:8080/job/XGSPON/job/3_Install_Bal_Psme/buildWithParameters?PLTFORM=asfvolt16&ONL_ID=b4af32e&PSME_VER=2.1.3.59.24&BAL_SDK_VER=3.2.2.2&MDATE=2019-12-10"
Install BAL SDK - Modify NNI port from 100G 40G. - Add ma1 as dhcp type. Install PSME Start daemon and unitest tool to let ONU to O5 state.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: Build_PSME_ONLY
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Only build PSEM only, set it to "True" This needs a well build ONL and BAL docker in env.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command: #!/bin/bash #Wait into ONL env. c=100 #c=1 while [ $c != 0 ];do c=$(($c-1)) sleep 1 echo $c done

buildStep.command:
#!/bin/bash #Above IP need modify to DUT's IP address echo "ONL_COMMIT_ID[$ONL_ID]" echo "PLTFORM[$PLTFORM]" echo "PSME_VER[$PSME_VER]" echo "BAL_SDK_VER[$BAL_SDK_VER]" echo "MDATE[$MDATE]"
cd / ##Remove exist deamon or server ## ntpdate -s time.stdtime.gov.tw tar zxvf release_*.tar.gz if [ "$?" != 0 ];then echo "Cannot tar BAL packages" exit 1 fi
dpkg -i psme_allinone*.deb if [ "$?" != 0 ];then echo "Cannot install PSME deb packages" exit 1 fi
update-rc.d psme defaults
cp /libbal_host_api.so /lib/ cp /libbal_host_api.so /usr/local/lib/ if [ "$?" != 0 ];then echo "Cannot copy libbal_host_api.so to lib!!" exit 1 fi
service psme start
# Insert BAL kernel module every time before startup. sed -i '/^exit 0/i \/opt\/bcm68620\/svk_init.sh' /etc/rc.local
# Use dhcp client to get IP address. sed -i '/^exit 0/i dhclient ma1' /etc/rc.local
# XGPS PON NNI PORTs set to 40G cd /broadcom/ sed -i 's/setenv port_speed_for_100 100000/setenv port_speed_for_100 40000/g' port_speed.soc
cd /opt/bcm68620/ ./svk_init.sh
cd /broadcom/ export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/broadcom nohup ./dev_mgmt_daemon -d -pcie < /dev/null > /dev/null 2>&1 & sleep 10 cd /broadcom/ nohup ./unittest_psme-chassis_acc_api_bal_dist_test < /dev/null > /dev/null 2>&1 & c=180 #c=1 while [ $c != 0 ];do c=$(($c-1)) sleep 1 echo $c done exit 0
